required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Safety and Efficacy of FFR Protocol in NTUH System
clinical_study.official_title: The Safety and Efficacy of Current FFR Measurement in NTUH Health Care System

lead_sponsor.agency: National Taiwan University Hospital Hsin-Chu Branch

clinical_study.source: National Taiwan University Hospital Hsin-Chu Branch

brief_summary.textblock: FFR-guided PCI has been performed in National Taiwan University Hospital(NTUH) for many years. Nevertheless, the method of FFR measurement in NTUH is different from that in literature. In this study, the investigator would like to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of NTUH experience in FFR prospectively. First, the investigator will record any intracoronary (IC) injected adenosine-related complications, such as bradyarrhythmia or chest discomfort. Second, the investigator will follow up on the clinical outcome of the participants for 2 years, record if any target lesion failure, target vessel failure, target vessel-related myocardial infarction, and cardiac death. Finally, left ventricular diastolic pressure, serum pro-brain natriuretic peptide (pro-BNP), and high sensitivity C- reactive protein (hsCRP) will be checked and determined their relationships with the maximum dosage of IC adenosine.

detailed_description.textblock: FFR has been introduced for the determination of physiological ischemia in the myocardium for many years. Nowadays, FFR-guided PCI is highly recommended for the assessment of physiologic ischemia in intermediate coronary lesions. FFR-guided PCI has been performed in National Taiwan University Hospital(NTUH) for many years. Nevertheless, the method of FFR measurement in NTUH is different from that in literature. In this study, the investigator would like to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of NTUH experience in FFR prospectively. First, the investigator will record any intracoronary (IC) injected adenosine-related complications, such as bradyarrhythmia or chest discomfort. Second, the investigator will follow up on the clinical outcome of the participants for 2 years, record if any target lesion failure, target vessel failure, target vessel-related myocardial infarction, and cardiac death. Finally, left ventricular diastolic pressure, serum pro-brain natriuretic peptide (pro-BNP), and high sensitivity C- reactive protein (hsCRP) will be checked and determined their relationships with the maximum dosage of IC adenosine.

primary_outcome.description: Including Bradyarrhythmia including sinus pause and transient AV block Acute respiratory failure define by respiratory distress which need mechanical ventilator support
MACE including target lesion failure, target vessel failure, target vessel-related myocardial infarction, and cardiac death

secondary_outcome.measure: The relationship between left ventricular diastolic pressure and maximum dosage of IC adenosine
secondary_outcome.description: Determine the correlation of left ventricular diastolic pressure and peak dosage of IC adenosine with FFR protocol in NTUH system

other_outcome.measure: The relationship between pro-BNP,hs-CRP and maximum dosage of IC adenosine
other_outcome.description: Determine the correlation of pro-BNP,,hs-CRP and peak dosage of IC adenosine with FFR protocol in NTUH system

study_pop.textblock: All subjects who had intermediate lesion over the coronary artery and eligible for FFR examination

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Eligible for FFR examination
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hypersensitivity to adenosine
- Severe valvular aortic stenosis
- Resting heart rate less than 50 beats per minute

overall_official.affiliation: National Taiwan University Hospital, Hsinchu Branch.

facility.name: National Taiwan University Hospital Hsin-Chu branch
